item.title: BUCHA ATROCITIES SHOCK WORLD
item.description:
apnews.com
BUCHA, Ukraine (AP) — Russia faced a fresh wave of condemnation on Monday after evidence emerged of what appeared to be deliberate killings of civilians in Ukraine. Some Western leaders called for further sanctions in response, even as Moscow continued to press its offensive in the country's east.

item.title: USA seizes yacht owned by oligarch with close ties to Putin...
item.description:
apnews.com
PALMA DE MALLORCA, Spain (AP) — The U.S. government seized a mega yacht in Spain owned by an oligarch with close ties to the Russian president on Monday, the first in the government’s sanctions enforcement initiative to “seize and freeze” giant boats and other pricey assets of Russian elites.

item.title: Beijing sends in military to help with Shanghai outbreak...
item.description:
apnews.com
BEIJING (AP) — China has sent more than 10,000 health workers from around the country to Shanghai, including 2,000 from the military, as it struggles to stamp out a rapidly spreading outbreak in its largest city under its zero-COVID strategy.

item.title: ORBAN LANDSLIDE
item.description:
apnews.com
BUDAPEST, Hungary (AP) — Prime Minister Viktor Orban declared victory in Sunday's national elections, claiming a mandate for a fourth term as a partial vote count predicted a strong lead for his right-wing party.
